news_header: Mitch McConnell, long-time Senate leader, announces retirement after health issues and a significant political career.
news_original_title: Pitkän linjan republikaanipoliitikko Mitch McConnell ei hae enää jatkokautta senaattorina
news_text: Mitch McConnell, the Republican leader of the Senate, announced that he will not seek re-election, marking the end of his nearly 20-year leadership. Having served since January 1985, the 83-year-old senator's current term expires in January 2027. McConnell has faced health challenges in recent years, including hospitalizations due to falls. He played a pivotal role in opposing President Obama and supporting Donald Trump's rise to the presidency in 2016. However, their relationship soured after Trump's unfounded claims of election fraud in 2020. Despite this, McConnell has continued to advocate for U.S. military aid to Ukraine amid ongoing conflict with Russia.
